meanings.definition: A confused mixture or medley of things
meanings.sent1: The jumble of toys on the floor made it hard to walk.
meanings.sent2: She sorted through the jumble of keys to find the right one.
meanings.sent3: The jumble of colors in the painting created a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like a jumble of thoughts, all tangled up.
meanings.sent5: The jumble of flavors in the dish made it a culinary adventure.

meanings.definition: To mix in a confused or disordered way
meanings.sent1: Please don't jumble the puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent2: She tends to jumble up her words when she's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally jumbled the ingredients, creating a new recipe.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were jumbled like a shaken snow globe.
meanings.sent5: The wind jumbled the leaves into a colorful whirlwind.
